questions.question: Solve: 2(x + 3) ≤ 4x - 2
questions.explanation: 2x + 6 ≤ 4x - 2 ⇒ 2x - 4x ≤ -2 - 6 ⇒ -2x ≤ -8 ⇒ x ≥ 4 (reverse inequality when dividing by negative)

questions.question: Find the smallest integer satisfying: 4x - 7 > 2x + 5
questions.explanation: 4x - 7 > 2x + 5 ⇒ 2x > 12 ⇒ x > 6. Smallest integer greater than 6 is 7.

questions.question: If x is an integer and 2 ≤ x < 7, what is the maximum value of x²?
questions.explanation: x can be 2,3,4,5,6. Maximum x is 6, so maximum x² = 6² = 36.

questions.question: Solve the simultaneous inequalities: x > 3 and x ≤ 8
questions.explanation: x > 3 AND x ≤ 8 means x is between 3 and 8, excluding 3, including 8: 3 < x ≤ 8

questions.question: If 1 < x ≤ 4 and -2 < y ≤ 3, what is the maximum possible value of x - y?
questions.explanation: Maximum x - y when x is max and y is min. Max x = 4, Min y approaches -2 (but y > -2). So x - y approaches 4 - (-2) = 6.

questions.question: A rectangle has length (2x + 3) cm and width 4 cm. Perimeter is at most 30 cm. Find maximum possible length.
